hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Regime Transition via 20D/50D SMA Death Cross with Volume Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC is in NEUTRAL regime (confidence >55%), a bearish regime transition is signaled when: (1) BTC price crosses below both 20-day and 50-day SMAs, (2) 20-day SMA crosses below 50-day SMA (death cross), (3) 5-day average volume exceeds 30-day average by >15%, and (4) ETH/BTC ratio declines >3% over 3 days. This transition pattern predicts a >8% BTC decline over the next 15 trading days with 65% accuracy.
hypothesis_content.rationale: NEUTRAL regimes represent equilibrium states vulnerable to directional breaks. Death crosses during elevated volume signal institutional distribution, while ETH/BTC weakness confirms broad crypto market deterioration rather than isolated BTC weakness. Historical analysis shows this multi-factor transition pattern precedes sustained bearish moves.
entry_conditions: BTC price < 20D SMA AND BTC price < 50D SMA
20D SMA < 50D SMA (cross confirmed for 2 consecutive days)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 15 days elapsed OR BTC price declines >12% from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price reclaims >50D SMA for 2 consecutive days

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If signal triggers but BTC shows <5% decline over 15 days OR >60% of such signals fail to produce BEAR regime within 20 days.
